arts.ttl: Frank Lampard pinpoints ‘special’ bit of play that elevated Coventry City player from ‘raw talent’ to ‘top level’
arts.sum: Frank Lampard hailed Ephron Mason-Clark’s ‘top level play’ after the winger scored to get Coventry City back in the game and then provided a brilliant assist for Jack Rudoni to head home the winner against bottom of the table Hull. The summer arrival from Peterborough United has come alive under the new head coach, scoring three goals and an assist in his first four games in charge of the Sky Blues, and the 46-year-old is convinced the player is going to get even better.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard delighted with his first CBS Arena win after Coventry City's scratch your head moment
arts.sum: Frank Lampard admitted he was left scratching his head at half-time when Coventry City came in trailing to Hull after dominating the play but being unable to find the back of the net. The team I picked today was relatively young and they are trying to do the right things and sometimes things go against you – like the goal going in for Hull when we have dominated the half.

arts.ttl: 'Frustrated' Ruben Selles pulls no punches after Hull City's defeat at Coventry City
arts.sum: We talked about things in the half-time and the early goal in the second half, we need to manage quite a bit better, so yes, I am a little bit frustrated for everyone in that dressing room. That lead, just as it did on Wednesday night against Watford, lasted a matter of minutes with Frank Lampard's side equalising early in the second period when Ephron Mason-Clark out-battled Lewie Coyle at the back post to score with his face.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings v Hull as EMC and Rudoni secure comeback home win - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Coventry, however, got themselves back on level terms seven minutes into the second half when Victor Torp sent in a cross from the right to the back post where Mason-Clark made contact with his face to beat the keeper. Second half goals from Ephron Mason-Clark and Jack Rudoni saw Coventry City come from behind to give Frank Lampard his first win at the CBS Arena – beating bottom of the league Hull.

arts.ttl: Defensive calamity sees Hull City beaten again by resurgent Coventry City
arts.sum: City had Ivor Pandur to thank for saving a second half penalty when Charlie Hughes gave away a foul inside the box, but shortly after, yet more haphazard defending allowed Jack Rudoni to head in from close range, and inflict a first defeat on the new head coach, who will have been left to scratch his head at some of the decision-making he saw from his side. As was the case in midweek, City couldn't hold their lead for any significant amount of time, conceding a really poor goal just seven minutes into the second period when skipper Lewie Coyle lost Ephron Mason-Clark at the back post to score with his face.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings at Coventry City as winless run extended to 13 Championship matches
arts.sum: Despite being dominated for the majority of a really poor first half, City stunned the CBS Arena by taking a 43rd minute lead when Joao Pedro snapped up a chance in front of goal after Ryan Longman headed Abu Kamara's cross against the woodwork. Just like on Wednesday night, the Tigers were unable to hold their lead for any amount of time and conceded early in the second half, and despite Ivor Pandur saving a penalty, the hosts went in front 19 minutes from time through Jack Rudoni's close-range header.

arts.ttl: Coventry City 2-1 Hull City: Frank Lampard picks up first home win of his Sky Blues tenure - as Chelsea icon leads his side to comeback win against struggling Tigers
arts.sum: HENRY CLARK AT THE COVENTRY BUILDING SOCIETY ARENA: Victory over the Tigers was the Chelsea legend's first at home since being appointed manager at the end of November.

arts.ttl: Jack Rudoni completes turnaround as Coventry earn Frank Lampard first home win
arts.sum: The Sky Blues battled back from behind to beat Ruben Selles’ Hull.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes three changes to his Coventry City team to face Hull at the CBS Arena
arts.sum: City: Brad Collins; Milan van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks, Jay Dasilva; Victor Torp, Ben Sheaf; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto, Jack Rudoni, Ephron Mason-Clark; Norman Bassette. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Hull City live updates and team news from the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Get the latest Coventry City headlines sent straight to your phone
